"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393dc506368723e947c0000#post_5393dc506368723e947c0000
While Mecha are very impractical for war

Police work, Construction, And Tournament style fights are probably more practical for them

In the Five star stories, They fight mortar headds instead of Engaging in war, In G gundam, The mobile fighters are explicitly meant for tournament fights

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393dd29636872123cfb0000#post_5393dd29636872123cfb0000
Seriously.
What are mechas usually made out of? It seems conventional weapons such as cruise missiles, AA Guns, and Tank shells don't seem to harm them at all, if they were shot from conventional  non-mecha military machines such as tank, battleships, turret guns and missile launchers, and aircrafts. Yet, only if it is those laser swords, or shots and pummeling made by other mechas, would it harm them. Typical Mecha anime logic.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393e0676368723db3f50100#post_5393e0676368723db3f50100
In real robot anime, Conventional weapons are usually either made absolete by a certain factor (Like the minovsky particles in Gundam) Even in the hands of Mecha, Conventional weapons generally don't do much unless It's VOTOMS (Because of the alloy they tend to be made out of)

In any other situation, I'd say suspension of disbelief

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393e45063687255d0de0200#post_5393e45063687255d0de0200
I meant obsolete

Using Gundam as an Example

Gundams are sturdy enough that bullets and Artillery shells don't do much, Soon enough, They get brought down to size once they start developing Beam weapons (Which pierce through mobile suit armor easily)

And By the time they start making beam resistant alloy, Ballistic weapons have improved enough that they're practical again
